result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition the court for expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $300.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Perform 40 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May expunge record if successfully completes probation and satisfies his financial obligations.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Kristyne Watson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Probation has been revoked.  Sentenced to serve 4 months in Co. Jail w/Huber, credit for 60 days served.  Civil judgment to be entered for unpaid financial obligations.
and revocation packet w/cover letter from agent Kelly Schauer.  (SEHR 12/16/15 at 8:50 a.m.)
Kristyne Watson  kmk
Cts.2&3 -Dismissed & read in  kmk
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Anthony J Martin, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2 & 3 - Dismissed and Read In. Sentencing arguments made.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 6 months with conditions.   As a condition court orders DE to complete 40 hours of Community Service.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine or $300 plus costs including DNA surcharge to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Anthony J Martin, appeared with Attorney Frederick L. Zievers.  Clerk: PT
Parties state case will be resolved and request another date for a plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 09:10 am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
